page.title: 01Area around Drem
page.content: Primarily a rich farming area, the land supports crops of barley some cabbage fields and other root crops and some dairy farming on rough grazing land adjacent to the railway. The large fields, bounded by hedges present an undulating somewhat monotonous landscape broken occasionally by the scattered farm steadings, small villages and isolated farm cottages. Housing is traditionally single storey often using traditional stone and clay partiled roofs. Many of the farm cotages are tithed. Drem is the main village but suppose only as small general store and sub post office. Population would be no more than 100. An historic site, Chesters Fort, lies just south of Drem and to the west is situated the Motor Museum. The main trasport lines through the area
